page.title: 04PAST AND PRESENT LIFE
page.content: {CHANGING TIMES} Pershore has seen many changes during its thousand year history. The religious quarrels of the{Reformation} which wasted much of the{Abbey of Holy {Cross}have been replaced by an{ {Ecumenical Covenant}which links the Christian religions of Pershore in our Modern Times. The{famous medieval {bridge,}the last of its kind over the Avon, now lives in the shadow of the modern road bridge. Pershore still retains the peace and tranquillity of its river setting but modern traffic roars along the High Street to remind its inhabitants of the fumes, noise and bustle of modern living. The original inhabitants are few but it has attracted a new, young, vigorous community who have preserved its character and are conscious of its past.
